text: Callixte Kalimanzira (1953–1 october 2015) was the Interior Minister of the interim government of Rwanda during the 1994 genocide. Kalimanzira was born in 1953 in Muganza Commune, Butare Prefecture.http://unictr.irmct.org/sites/unictr.org/files/case- documents/ictr-05-88/appeals-chamber-judgements/en/101020.pdf Kalimanzira was indicted in 2005 by the International Criminal Tribunal for Rwanda for his actions during the genocide on three counts: genocide, complicity in genocide and direct and public incitement to commit genocide;http://unictr.unmict.org/sites/unictr.org/files/case- documents/ictr-05-88/indictments/en/050721.pdf he pleaded not guilty. On 22 June 2009, Kalimanzira was sentenced to 30 years in prison for two counts of genocide and direct and public incitement to commit genocide. The sentence was reduced on appeal to 25 years imprisonment in October 2010.http://unictr.unmict.org/en/cases/ictr-05-88 Kalimanzira died on 1 October 2015 while serving his sentence in Benin. == Notes and references == Category:2015 deaths Category:1953 births Category:People indicted by the International Criminal Tribunal for Rwanda Category:Government ministers of Rwanda Category:People convicted of incitement to genocide
